title.narrative: IR2.2:LEARNING ACHIEVEMENTS&QUALITY ED

description.narrative: By December 2016, 90% of municipalities from Semi-arid, Amazon and those with more than 150 thousand inhabitants strengthened capacities to guarantee Quality Basic Education to all children and adolescents, particularly the most marginalized, reducing inequalities, decreasing drop out and retention rates and increasing enrollment and attendance, literacy, learning achievements and conclusion rates., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Hygiene, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, each and every child aged 4 to 17 exercising their constitutional right to basic education municipalities and state public schools network achieved or surpassed quality official index (IDEB 2015) goals teachers and municipal education and school managers have their capacities developed for quality education basic education drop out and retention rates of most disadvantaged boys and girls decrease in the Amazon, Semiarid and in the 174 municipalities with more than 150 thousand inhabitants, especially among indigenous, quilombola, riparian, afro-Brazilians children and adolescents, those with disabilities, and also the most vulnerable to emergencies and disaster risks.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By December 2016, 90% of municipalities from Semi-arid, Amazon and those with more than 150 thousand inhabitants strengthenedcapacities to guarantee Quality Basic Education to all children and adolescents, particularly the most marginalized, reducinginequalities, decreasing drop out and retention rates and increasing enrollment and attendance, literacy, learning achievementsand conclusion rates.

description.narrative: UNICEF Brazil led the agenda on children and adolescent's right to learn, strengthening capacities from different social actors on issues related to quality education and reducing inequalities on access, retention and learning achievements for the most excluded ones. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and participating in the 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy participating in face to face or virtual events, held with UNICEF support, to exchange experiences and best practices, including comprehensive education to ensure the right to learn, focusing on reducing regional, race and ethnicity, gender and personal condition inequalities.

baseline.value: % of the municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and in 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy that participated in 2011 in face-to-face or virtual e

target.value: 2014:80 % of the municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy participated in face-to-face or virtual events held wi

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal in the SAB and Amazon regions and in the 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy are informed on how to use the Quality Indicators for Early Childhood Education and the National Curriculum Guidelines for Child Education to plan their actions regarding their early childhood education networks.

baseline.value: According to a survey conducted in partnership with the NGO Ac?o Educativa and COEDI/MEC.

target.value: 2014:80% of the municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and in 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy participated in face-to-face or virtual events held

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and in 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy participating in face-to-face or virtual training activities with UNICEF's support to apply Laws 10,639 and 11,645.

baseline.value: Data for the 2009-2012 Edition of the Seal in the SAB and PAM regions (N/A for capitals and large cities).

target.value: 2014:for the SAB and Amazon regions: 70% of the municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and PAM regions with educational managers trained with UNICEF

actual.value: 2016:SAB: 76% (867/1134) Amazon region: 46% (135/294) PCU: n/a (no ongoing actions for this purpose)

title.narrative: % of NGOs registered in the Itau UNICEF Award who participated in training activities that included contents related to comprehensive education as a strategy to reduce inequalities and ensure the right to learn

baseline.value: Results of the 8th Edition of Itau UNICEF Award

target.value: 2014:2012 and 2014: To be defined with partners - Fundac?o Itau Social and CENPEC

actual.value: 2016:73% of the NGO's registered in the UNICEF Award 11th edition (2015-2016) participated in training activities that included contents related to comprehensive education as a strategy to reduce inequalities and ensure the right to learn.

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and participating in 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy that ensured electricity and water supply, bathrooms, kitchens and quality gender-sensitive sanitary and hygiene conditions in their school networks.

baseline.value: for the SAB region: School Census, complemented by a survey to be carried out in partnership with Undime. for the Amazon region: School Census, complemented by a survey to be carried out in partnershi

target.value: 2014:for the SAB and Amazon regions and for 08 Capitals participating in the PCU strategy: 60% of all municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and 08 Capitals par

actual.value: 2016:SAB: 48% (316/658) Amazon region: 50% (304/611) PCU: n/a (no ongoing actions for this purpose)
